item.description:
If interested in the following, please put yourself on the established waiting list.  A yes list will be provided as soon as possible.

 

Criteria:  All hikers must be able to maintain a minimum pace of two miles an hour for a minimum of two hours.  All hikers must have cold weather gear and be experienced above treeline in winter conditions.

 

All attendees must read, understand and agree to the waiver/liability as outlined by this website.

 

This trail begins on Starr King Rd., a gravel road to several houses that leaves the north side of US 2 (trail sign) 0.2 mi. east of its junction with NH 115A.   Driving Directions

 

starting at Starr King Trailhead Back to here hike 2.60 mi/2 hr 29 min/+2313 ft on the Starr King Trail From the parking area, ascend gradually on a grassy logging road for 100 yd., then turn left (arrow) and ascend another 100 yd. to meet the old route of the trail, a logging road on which the trail turns uphill to the right and soon passes the stone foundations of a springhouse (right). The trail bears right and ascends the broad southwest ridge of the mountain. It angles left and runs north on a long traverse of the west flank of the mountain, passing a spring on the left (downhill side) of the trail. to Mt Starr King hike 1.00 mi/39 min/+108 ft on the Starr King Trail Swinging right and leaving the traverse, the trail climbs to the summit, then continues another 60 yd. to a cleared vista south and west (slowly being encroached upon by tree growth) at the site of a former shelter. From the remains of the old cabin’s fireplace, the trail enters the woods again, angling left, then swings right (east) and follows close to the crest of the ridge or slightly below it on one side or the other, dipping just below the col on the south and then rising to the summit of Mt. Waumbek, where it meets the south end of the Kilkenny Ridge Trail. to Mt Waumbek Totals Distance 3.60 mi Time 3 hr 8 min Elev Gain +2669 ft Elev Loss -248 ft Elev Change +2421 ft   Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS Back to here hike 1.00 mi/39 min/-108 ft on the Starr King Trail The Starr King Trail leaves the Kilkenny Ridge Trail and the summit of Mt. Waumbek headed due west. It drops into a col. and follows close to the crest of the ridge or slightly below it on one side or the other, dipping just below the col on the south. It leaves the woods at the remains of the old cabin’s fireplace and continues to a cleared vista south and west (slowly being encroached upon by tree growth) at the site of a former shelter. Traversing another 60 yd., the trail arrives at the summit of Mt. Starr King. to Mt Starr King hike 2.60 mi/2 hr 29 min/-2313 ft on the Starr King Trail It leaves the summit and runs south on a long traverse of the west flank of the mountain, passing a spring on the right (downhill side) of the trail. The trail turns and descends the broad southwest ridge of the mountain. The trail continues to descend modestly on an old logging road and passes the stone foundations of a springhouse (left). The trail leaves the old route and descends 100yd. to a grassy logging road which it follows 100 yd. to the parking area. to Starr King Trailhead Totals Distance 7.20 mi Time 6 hr 16 min Elev Gain +2917 ft Elev Loss -2917 ft Elev Change 0 ft   Driving Directions
item.how_to_find_us: We will be in a silver four door Subaru Legacy
item.name: Mt Waumbek
